result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

State's inducement letter of 10/19/22.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.

Defendant stands mute as to sole count.  Not guilty plea(s) entered by the court.  Jury calendar.

1:34 pm -  Defendant Francisco Coretz-Mendez appearing in custody.  Attorney Carl Knepel in court for Essence C Irving.  Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  John Vaughn is sworn to interpret for the defendant.  Initial appearance is adjourned to 09-26-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3 to confirm if he has an attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

1:43 pm - Defendant Francisco Cortez-Mendez appeared by video, in custody at Manitowoc County Jail.  Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. John Vaughn, by zoom, is sworn to interpret for the defendant.  Defendant has an attorney on another case and needs to check with him if he can take this case also. Initial appearance is reset to 09-19-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.  Bail is set at $1,500.00 recognizance bond.  Defendant refused to sign.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
